Perimeter and area of a circle

  1. The distance covered by travelling once around a circle is its perimeter or circumference.
  2. \(Circumference=\pi \times (2r)\), where r is the radius of the circle and \(\pi =\frac{22}7\)
  4. By cutting a circle in number of sectors and rearranging them we can get a rectangle with breadth=r and length=\(0.5\times [\pi \times (2r)]\)
  5. Thus, area of a circle=\(\pi \times r^2\)
